An analysis of #COVID19 task forces from 87 countries found only 3.5% had gender parity. For a more inclusive future, women must be involved in the #COVID19 response recovery. On #IWD2021, join us and @UN_Women to demand more women in decision-making! https://t.co/CJ7AQQyxq3

No matter which way you slice the data it seems the mental health in many nations around the world has declined, which is not particularly surprising, - #COVID19 Commissioner @lbaknin. She talks #mentalhealth more in this interview w/ @VancouverSun https://t.co/4evkdAJqxz

The #COVID19 Commission is proud to share, "Enhancing Global Cooperation to End the COVID-19 Pandemic: Statement of the Lancet COVID-19 Commission." The statement details the top three priorities to suppress the pandemic in 2021. Read here: https://t.co/mDSDbFFtJB https://t.co/7SGIAfgtwi

Since underlying health conditions increase the risk of #COVID19 , understanding the number of people at risk and how this varies between countries should inform the design of strategies to shield those at high risk. Read more about it @TheLancet here-> https://t.co/8v1UHrWI5F

Medical populism in which leaders spread false information about medical knowledge to downplay the virus or spectacularize the crisis, has contributed to this failure. Learn more about the failure of the suppression of the pandemic from our task force-> https://t.co/luYf2hHQpP

Several countries have failed to suppress the pandemic. This is often due to a failure to implement the full package of NPIs, as well as high inequality, low social trust, and political polarization. https://t.co/9JXq6cb9Ed

This @WHO report highlights the disruption of immunizations due to #COVID19, as well as previous concerns over the virus transmission when attempting to receive vaccinations. The authors stress the importance of the delivery of routine vaccinations. https://t.co/LICaUJqrGJ

.@UNICEF published in May 2020 that #COVID19 will significantly impact maternal and infant mortality. It provides models from the Lancet Global Health journal, and incorporates how access to food and missed immunizations add to high rates of mortality https://t.co/DGn7Dd6w6Q

How has #COVID19 impacted teenage girls in #Kenya? Pregnancies in young girls have risen due to the increase of transactional sex to help support their families financially. School closures have increased sexual violence and healthcare systems are strained https://t.co/NHuay2H7dR

Time Magazine reports how #COVID19 has disproportionately affected women in major industries of the U.S. economy, accounting for more job losses than men in every sector. Experts report that this is due to women having to balance employment and family care.https://t.co/CHNqPcnVV1

This UN report lays out a socioeconomic response plan to compliment existing health #COVID19 response plans. The framework consists of: 1. Health 2. Social 3. Environment 4. Economic Protections for vulnerable populations https://t.co/pB7XtaB1Ky

"The @IMFNews is providing financial assistance and debt service relief to member countries facing the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. This page provides an overview of assistance approved by the IMFs Executive Board since March 2020." https://t.co/W1kjRapceA

Research shows that the #COVID19 pandemic has the potential to push 100 million people into poverty on a global scale. Read more on this impact from @WEF -> https://t.co/sPZZjNXMZL

#COVID19 has major economics impacts: the article reveals old and underlying deep racial and socioeconomic divides, and the recent protests of demanding reform of systems of policing that have harmed black people for centuries -> https://t.co/pxKypB541P

How has #COVID19 impacted #SDG1? The @WorldBank reports that due to COVID-19, extreme poverty is likely to increase ~.5-1%, representing 71 million more people. The extreme poor will be concentrated mostly in South Asia (~50%) and Sub-Saharan Africa (~33%) https://t.co/6iWYtIeE3o

Meet Commissioner Laurence Boone. Boone is the OECD Chief Economist and Head of the Economics Department. In her role on the Lancet Commission, Ms. Boone will be supported by Ms. Francesca Colombo, Head of the Health Division at the OECD. @LauBooneEco https://t.co/UFKUVluH04 https://t.co/NIElcFw8GJ
